title: ‘Russian agent’ Maria Butina to be deported
text: Russian gun rights activist and lobbyist Maria Butina, who the mainstream media had labeled a “Russian agent,” was released Friday from prison and is expected to be immediately deported to Moscow. RT America’s Rachel Blevins has the story. Meanwhile, British Columbia is the first Canadian province to introduce legislation that will align its laws and policies with the United Nations Declaration on the Rights of Indigenous Peoples. RT’s Alex Mihailovich reports from Toronto. Then RT America’s John Huddy explains why a former Trump administration education official says billions of dollars in student debt should be erased. Plus, RT America’s Natasha Sweatte reports on fierce winds fueling fires in California.
description: Russian gun rights activist and lobbyist Maria Butina, who the mainstream media had labeled a “Russian agent,” was released Friday from prison and is expected to be immediately deported to Moscow
